And the ass on the phone doesn't even let you speak to express the utter crap of a scam this racket is and how they ought to put this information in the description. Absolutely reporting to the Better Business Bureau.

Review.Titre: Abe's of Maine is a bait-and-switch company
Review.Contenu: Abe's of Maine is a bait-and-switch company. Their website is purposely inadequate and misleading which prompts a call from their sales department attempting to up-sell to the product believed to have been originally ordered, only at a much higher price. When I told the salesperson to cancel my order because I was turned off by their tactics, he wished me good luck and hung up on me. I found the same item on Amazon (slightly higher price) with next day delivery, opposed to the three to four weeks from Abe's of Maine.

Immediately after placing my order, I got a call from them asking me to call and "confirm" it. While on the phone they tried to upsell me into buying a package instead of the product I ordered, telling me it is oversold (even though it's still listed as in stock even right now). So I can either stick with the original order if I'm "okay with it taking 3-4 weeks," he said, or take a package deal with an extended warranty and an accessory for $100 more, which will then ship in three days. This recalls the Bad Old Days of internet ordering. I will absolutely never, never buy from Abe's of Maine again.

To add insult to injury, he had to audacity to accuse me of making up stories. I have reported the company to Consumer protection agency  and since we implement US Government contracts, I have also reported Abe's to other agency bodies for inferior trading standards and unfair business services.

I placed an order online over the weekend. The price for the camera I wanted was better than other online retailers. The order was accepted, and I received confirmation. When Monday came around, I had voice and email messages from someone named Ted at the company saying he needed to talk to me to confirm my order. I have no idea what needed to be confirmed, as everything seemed straightforward online. Other reviews here concerned me about the point of such a conversation. I attempted to return the call during Abe's operating hours, and ended up on hold for more than a half hour. I sent an email reply to Ted, saying please just process my order and get it sent. I received no acknowledgment of that email, just another voicemail saying he was returning my call, and that I should call him to confirm the order. I tried one more time, and again found myself on hold for an extended period of time before I gave up and disconnected. I sent an email to every address I had for the company and directed that my order be canceled. I received confirmation that it was canceled.Insisting that a customer speak to you on the phone, then having nobody available during business hours to take the call is unacceptable customer service. I don't want to make a major purchase from that kind of retailer. When the awful hold music is interrupted with "Your call is very important to us," it's just insulting. If my call were important, the company would have an appropriate staffing level to answer it. Also, when I reply to an email quite specifically, but do not receive any acknowledgment of that, it's another red flag. Finally, this company is in New Jersey, so the name is totally disingenuous.I didn't experience everything some people have posted about here, but everything that happened suggested we were headed in that direction. Why else would they be pushing to speak on the phone? I'm relieved I was able to cancel the order. I'd rather pay more and have peace of mind that I'm dealing with someone more reputable.

If you are looking for in warranty Nikon you should avoid the site. The service lady told me i was a difficult customer when i asked for refund. They gave my money back.

Bought a TV.  A nice one.  An expensive one.  Free shipping.   A follow up phone call a day later requiring shipping insurance, extra money to be charged.  What happened to free shipping?  These guys are so misleading.  I cancelled.  They are a disgrace to the state of Maine, even if they are located in Jersey.

I purchased a new tv at good but fair price with free shipping online from their website. I was then called and told that the shipping would still be free but I would have to pay for the insurance because the screen was glass. I said okay to find out that the cost of "insurance" was actually more than other retailers were charging for shipping. What a con. Won't buy from them again.

Review.Titre: Gray market camera purchase on black friday - high pressure upsell.
Review.Contenu: I purchased a Nikon P1000 for a good price on black friday from this company.  I was surprised to receive an email that I needed to call and confirm my purchase.  The sales person proceeded to try to upsell products and warranty.  Got off the phone and found they are selling gray market goods without warranty.  Nikon will not recognize.

Review.Titre: I was bait and switched by this company…
Review.Contenu: I was bait and switched by this company and paid the extra money for filters and a warranty. A year later I just went to send in the lens to Nikon for repair and was told it was a gray market lens and now Nikon won't even look at it, let alone repair it. The company will not answer their phone and now it is too late to dispute the charge with my bank. DO NOT BUY FROM THEM, I should've looked into reviews a bit more before buying,

Review.Titre: Terrible experience.  Rude customer service.  Website lists out of stock items as in stock.
Review.Contenu: Ordered a TV from their website.  Website stated item was in stock.  The next day, I received an e-mail to call them.  I called, had to provide my order number 3 times to the same person and was then rudely told that the TV I ordered was not in stock and that my order will be cancelled.  No apologies, no offers to sell me another TV at a discount for my inconvenience.  I will never order anything from AbesofMaine again.

Same story, got suckered in by the cyber Monday sale, got the phone call, they made it seem like they were doing me a favor when they sold me an accessory I didn’t need and misled me about the price and now won’t cancel the order even though it hasn’t been shipped yet. So frustrating!

Whom ever wrote a good review for Abes of Maine have to be an employee because this place is a scam!!!! The prices are FAKE and my bank fraud Department called me that they try to widrawed money of my account 8 different times from $3700 to $100 in one day!!!! This place should be shut down for being a fraud. Trust me this company is the ultimate scam artist. Dont fall for the trap!!!! Those prices are Fake!!!

Steve from "Abe's of Maine" (www.abesofmaine. just tried to do a bait and switch on a Nikon lens I ordered from their website on their Black Friday Sale. The webpage I ordered the lens from shows the Manufacturer Part number and that is what I ordered. If you want all of the pieces that are included in the box from Nikon they want $200 more dollars. Do not do business with these cheaters.

Review.Titre: Bought 2K Tv and they called me 3 days …
Review.Contenu: Bought 2K Tv and they called me 3 days later to tell me it was $300 more for insurance, What a scam. TV came and delivery service was supposedly white glove they set up tv . What a joke! Guys could not speak English and could not back truck out of my driveway without making big ruts in my grass! White glove service is total rip off will just go to Best Buy for my next TV!

Bait-and-switch. Abusive selling tactics. After they sent an invoice for a final price, 'Steve' called and said I had to pay an extra $288 for handling and insurance, or else they would cancel the order. This is dishonest and fraudulent. I ordered over cyber weekend when everyone had low prices and of course now no other retailer can even come close. Very dishonest and sad.

Review.Titre: Stay away from Abes of Maine
Review.Contenu: Bunch of BS...I ordered a lens that I saw on sale. I liked the sale price so I ordered it. I got an email that asked me to call and speak to Ted-who was also rude. He said that the brand new lens I had just ordered did not come with lens caps, hood or case as it is supposed to and that I would have to pay extra....Well I have purchased quite a few new lenses in my time and they always come with caps and hood when sold new. Bait and switched me so I told them to cancel it.

Review.Titre: THIS COMPANY USES BAIT AND SWITCH…
Review.Contenu: THIS COMPANY USES BAIT AND SWITCH TECHNIQUES THEN YOU QUESTION THEM ON IT THEY TRY TO OFFER YOU SOME NEGLIGIBLE AMOUNT OF MONEY AND IMPOSE A 15% RESTOCKING FEE ON YOUR ORDER. I DID NOT RESEARCH THEM GOOD ENOUGH AND THAT IS MY FAULT BUT THEY SHOULD NOT REPRESENT ANY MAJOR CAMERA AS AN AUTHORIZED DEALER. VERY VERY DISAPPOINTING

They are scammers. I would not even give them one star if that was an option. They offered a "sale" price on a Canon lens. Then called and said it was a gray market lens and I had to pay $180 more for a US warranty lens. Then shipped me the international lens. DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THESE CROOKS!

I purchased a  Sony XBR75X940D on their web site.  I got an email to confirm my purchase.  I called and they asked if I wanted the tv that was made in Mexico or the made in China model. Geeze!!  Lots of lies and stupid stuff to try and get me to buy tge better version.   Price increased $1200.  I've been through this type of bait and switch crap before.  I cancelled the order.

They call you the next day saying there was something wrong with the billing information, then proceed to push accessories, warranties, etc. These extra accessories are cheaply made, not worth the price. Please read the other reviews online about Abes of Maine, they were formerly a reputable and honest company, but they've since been bought and their business practices have changed for the worst.

Despite 3 attempts to contact, I’ve not received a reply. No order update or shipping notification. Stated ships 1-3 business days. We are on day 7. States 24 hour response time, it’s been more than 72. Will be calling my credit card company to dispute the charge.

I purchased a $6500 camera through their website. Later in the day I received a phone call from a representative who told me the product as in fact a grey market item without any of the supplied accessories-- no warranty, battery, charger, cables, etc. He asked if I wanted to purchase any of those things; he also informed me that he could send a non-grey market item for $600 more. No where on the web page did it state that the camera was grey market or missing accessories. He claimed the item was grey market because they weren't a dealer for the brand, yet offered to get the "real" item for me.  Highly deceptive.

Review.Titre: Shady business practices- avoid Abes of Maine
Review.Contenu: Purchased a new tv today 2/18/19 from Abes of Maine. Received an email asking me to call to confirm the order. Upon doing so, the agent confirmed the purchased and then refused to honor the purchase price without charging an additional $400 for “insurance” I didn’t need. Avoid doing business with this shady company.

The website is a scam! After purchasing the TV as the advertised price I received a call from “Ted” indicating I had to pay an additional almost $500 for “shipping insurance”. The listing on the website made no mention of it nor did the email confirmation I received from placing the order. ted tried to negotiate with me the insurance cost by “throwing it” white glove delivery and applying phantom discounts so I would purchase the TV. I decided not to take the bite and take my business somewhere else where honesty is valued.

Review.Titre: Bait and switch plus delay, delay, delay
Review.Contenu: First, they use bait and switch selling tactics. I purchased a TV that listed insurance as optional, but 5 days later receive a phone call to finalize the purchase and I was then told an additional $300 insurance policy was required in order to ship the unit. Second, delivery date was inaccurate along with poor communication about its ETA. Definitely feels like a SCAM website with poor customer service. Also, scary this is a company that is linked with CNET.com which is how I originally stumbled upon them.

Review.Titre: Abes of Maine is one of the worst…
Review.Contenu: Abes of Maine is one of the worst places to buy TV's.  Once you make a purchase you will receive an email to contact them to confirm. Once you do they immediately try to up sell you because the tv on the website is no longer available. In particular watch out for a salesman who goes by the name Jeff Stevens. When you try to cancel your order he tells you you are "harassing his phone" (I can't make this stuff up).  Once again, maybe good for cameras but for TV's go somewhere else.

Purchased Sony A7R IV. Received email notification that order would be processed in a few days.   Then got another email to confirm order.   They wanted me to buy additional battery because they said the factory battery would only last 30 minutes. It doesn't make sense, I work for Sony for 4 years and they do not make camera battery that would last 30 minutes.  Then, I was told the camera is in back order and would take 2 weeks to ship. I will update this review once I get the camera. I bet you they are trying to get out of sale from selling it at a low price.

Review.Titre: Buyer beware, I would go somewhere else next time.
Review.Contenu: I thought it was very easy shopping. Until you get a customer service person who calls you and they start jacking the price up adding all this stuff to your order. It's ridiculous. I just wanted what I originally ordered, and had no need to speak to a customer service. But they wouldn't ship until I spoke to them, they said it was to verify the order. Bulls%&t, it was to jack up my order with all this high dollar extras, that aren't even worth it. You can get that stuff cheaper on Amazon. So be careful buying from this place.

Review.Titre: Bait and Switch - Not the Abe's Of Memory
Review.Contenu: Bait and switch. Be ready to have an immediate call with a salesperson who will then explain why you can't get what you ordered. In my case, the advertised Canon 5D Mark IV for $2000 was the 'Korean Made' international model made of inferior materials. And I would much rather have the american made one for $2500+. Then the camera arrived having been opened already - I ordered a body only so they sent me a box for a camera/lens bundle with the lens taken out. Fishy? For sure. I'm not a lawyer, but avoid the hassles.

Review.Titre: Do not buy from these people
Review.Contenu: Do not buy from these people. They sell great market cameras and expect to pay hundreds extra if you want a box, charger, and battery. Not disclosed anywhere on site. Charged $299 for a $35 battery grip. Once you order you will get a "verification call" which is simply an up-sell, heavy pressure sales pitch. Buy from a reputable vendor and save yourself the hassle and frustration.  Good luck trying to reach someone on the phone. Sales staff are rude and pushy and unprofessional. Really disappointed.

Typical SCAM! Bait and switch in its glory! They will call you back and say we are out of stock on whatever you are buying for the price advertised but wait... We have special for great customers like you, oh behold we can sell you retail version of the product that includes all basic accessories that should be included in the first place for the huge up charge from the advertised price. STAY CLEAR! Very rude on the phone, will almost try to make you feel bad for not buying their one time special...bunch of loosers!

Review.Titre: Grey market dealers with false listings
Review.Contenu: Purchased a New Fujifilm camera with lenses. Following day I get an email from them for me to call them, to confirm the order, (Like they cant call). I call their number and they start telling me how good a deal I got, because it was on sale. Then they said "you know there is no warranty on this product", and if I want a warranty I have to purchase it for another $500. I complained that this was unacceptable, and that their listing did not state the absence of any warranty.  They were also rude. Told them to cancel the order. Will never buy here again.

Scammed by these people! They are NOT an authorized Canon USA dealer! Beware! We were “upsold” to a USA version Canon camera instead of an import. Of course it was also bundled with a backpack, tripod, etc. What we got was a Chinese or import camera in an opened beat up box that didn’t match the product we purchased. There was NO Canon warranty card in the box at all. It also had a battery charger with the plug on the top, not the back. Canon’s own website shows this as an example of a gray market product. All of the bundle items were incredibly cheap crap. Christmas was almost ruined because of the sheer greed and dishonesty of this company. Use this company at your own risk. Always look for authorized dealers!

Total SCAM.  Price draws people in only to find out there are "handling and insurance fees" that are outrageous.  website says "free shipping" not true.  just try to get your purchase without.  Chief Liar Ted is a practiced scam artist.  Googled their reviews after something didn't sit right and sure enough Ted is all over the internet with others who have been taken.  I called back immediately to cancel and was told my order was already on the truck.  turns out, not true - again.  Checked with trucking company and they didn't pick up my purchase until the next day.

Review.Titre: BEWARE! AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!! ALL OF THEIR POSITIVE REVIEWS ARE FAKE!
Review.Contenu: BEWARE! Artificially low prices! We placed an order then 5 minutes later a rude and offensive salesman called and said the camera we ordered was the Japanese version and tried to upsell us by $700 for the American version! Then when we wanted to canceled and they threatened to charge us a 15% cancellation fee. Then when we said that ridiculous asked to waive the fee they said “what you going to do about it”  Pieces of work ruining peoples day. NO way they have this many positive reviews.. if you look at them they are clearly fake!! Avoid at all costs! good luck abe!

Shady business practices where they will call after you make purchases and said part of your order is less than what they show online and offer to give you better deal and where you’ll have to pay more to get. First time buying from this company and it will be my last.

Review.Titre: False promises and a bad deal
Review.Contenu: Responded on a good offer on a Nikon d850 with a discount on the list price of 47 USD. Was called by the store claiming that the offer was without the standard equipment of similar offer like the battery. Ended up paying 500 USD more than the list price for an imported version of the canera without any US warranty. Slow an rude responds from the sales person with lack of important information about the product delivered. The store calls for a 15% restocking charge which would leave me with an even bigger loss despite an obvious bad deal. BEWARE!

Review.Titre: Stop calling me and changing the price.

Review.Contenu: They will upsell you over the phone and you’re not able to see more details online.. the salesperson I spoke to had pushy and annoying tactics to upsell, make something feel ‘rare’ when I can easily get the same deal a few hundred dollars less on another site.

Bait and switch unfortunately. I got a call from a salesperson saying that what they advertised as available isn't and that the wait would be 4-6 weeks and that the firmware cannot be updated. I was offered the us copy instead for more money.Why was i not surprised:(

Review.Titre: Adam, Ted are not to be Trusted
Review.Contenu: Adam contacted me, trying to sell a warranty and a memory card for well over the retail value. I initially thought the "package" was a good deal, but upon research, the memory card was exorbitantly priced, and the warranty did not cover accidents or theft. Adam said that he would take "package" off and would reship. He wound up cancelling the entire order, without warning. I am beyond livid. In calling back to see what the heck went wrong, I spoke to Ted and he tried selling me some horse hockey about how they were trying to ship the the "american made" version so that it would get to me faster than the "china version." Which is so extra. I just ordered a camera, it takes 3 days to process and 3 days to ship, how then would it take 3 weeks to arrive? I hung up and decided to try ordering online again....I hope I don't regret this.

They advertise great prices to lure you into making an online purchase, then you get an email that you have to call them to confirm the order -- this is really a tactic to sell you a higher priced item...It goes like this... "Thanks for purchasing this great lens, but did you know it's not a US model and there's no warranty. Ah, you didn't notice the fine print on the web page when you placed the order. I'll sell you a 2 year warranty for $99 more. Oh, you don't want the warranty, well how about the US model for $150 more that comes with a warranty & I'll throw in a lens filter. And if you buy the US model it will ship within 3 days, whereas the Intl model will take 2-3 weeks. Sorry we didn't mention that when you placed the online order...

Review.Titre: Bait and Switch, Product Not In Stock
Review.Contenu: Product wasn’t actually in stock and they’re not an authorized vendor of Fujifilm products. They attempted to upsell me but the product didn’t ship in the time I was told, so I cancelled my order. Order cancellation was easy, so I gave them an extra star for that.

Review.Titre: Dealt with Abe's of Maine many years…
Review.Contenu: Dealt with Abe's of Maine many years ago and they had great pricing then and also now, Bought a Sony A7R IV NEW for the lowest price I could find. Why buy the same thing at a higher price?Update... Received a call from the sales lady J*** who apologized and informed me they didn't have the exact items I wanted so I cancelled the order and she sent me an email with the cancellation information. If I need any lenses or cameras in the future, I will most definitely call to order. Apparently the "supply chain" issue is negatively impacting every business in America.. so unnecessary..!
Tried to checkout using the "Checkout Finance" option, and it wouldn't load

Review.Titre: Purchased a TV - Bait and Switch
Review.Contenu: Purchased a TV.  Received an email requiring me to call in to "verify my purchase".  At the very end of the call I was told I needed to pay $188 of insurance to ship a $1900 TV.  Even the guy on the phone knew it was ridiculous.  Nowhere on their site or during the purchase process is there any mention of having to pay some type of bogus shipping insurance fee.  Definitely a "bait and switch".

Review.Titre: This review is a little premature in as…
Review.Contenu: This review is a little premature in as much as I have not received the merchandise yet.  The only thing I can comment on is that the web site is easy to navigate and understand.  It remains to be seen if their business practices are on the same level.Edit 5-26-21:  In my case, the transaction was a classic bait and switch.  They did not have the product in stock as advertised, and then attempted to sell me another one at over $400 more than retail price, which I declined.  They may be fine in some cases, but I won't be doing business with them again.

I bought a Sony A7R3 over the weekend and immediately canceled the next business day after reading reviews. This place does not open at the time listed. Once they pick up they put you on hold again till you hang up. However, when I finally got through, the lady I talked to was polite and canceled my order right away. Do yourself a favor and buy from an authorized camera dealer.

Review.Titre: Return policy sucks and shipping is…
Review.Contenu: Return policy sucks and shipping is listed as too long to try and get you to pay more for expedited shipping.  But the price is good.  I will reserve judgment until I actually receive it and set it up. I ended up canceling the order.  First they tried to up sell me to the newer model by saying they had that model in NJ and the one I ordered was in their California warehouse.  I kept the original order.  10 days later they hadn’t even shipped it so I canceled.  They were cool about the cancellation though so I’ll give them that.

I called the phone number to simply ask if the lens was an officially imported US lens covered under the standard Nikon warranty and I got a rude response that I'm not even sure answered my question.  Agent just kept repeating himself without trying to understand what I was actually asking.

I ordered a lens much cheaper than anywhere else but before I got my "verification call" I found these reviews so I knew I was going to cancel. When they called, I told them, I ordered the thing and now I had second thoughts because I really don't want it after thinking about it. The guy seemed taken aback, but I went on about how it goes, you see something, order then wish you had a chance to change your mind. I said I was glad I had a chance to cancel it. They canceled the order without any sales push at all. Glad I saw the reviews at just the right time. Eventually ordered one in good quality used version from B&H, which I always trust.

There was a miscalculation on the product page for the discount of the product. I called the 1-800-992-2237 sales number to ask about the incorrect price. I waited 30 minutes as caller 2 then caller 1 then the call dropped. I called back and was dropped again after waiting 30 minutes, this time being caller 1 and never left that status. I hope Abe's of Maine sees this so they can address their order staff. I usually side with the Covid delays, but I believe companies need to know that customers have a lot of choices and customer service is still very important. I don't think this is the norm as they state they have been in business 30 yrs, but it doesn't hurt to receive feedback when a 1st time customer experiences this.

Review.Titre: Lowest prices for TV and other items but beware
Review.Contenu: AbesofMain has the lowest prices on TV's but uses deception to get more money out of you.  1.  You will have to call or they will call you before charging and shipping item.   2.  Shipping is "free" but insurance will be around $250.50.   3. When they quote the $250.50 insurance they will say something like twenty-five fifty which in layman terms means $25.50.  Very deceptive.   Or they will up-sell you accessories that have a $1000 percent mark-up.   I respect that they are in business to make money and  In all you may get your TV or other item at the lowest cost but who wants to deal with a company that is deceptive and lacks transparency.   I don't.

Review.Titre: Listings are deceptive / online inventory not accurate
Review.Contenu: Listings are a bit deceptive : they do not list what's in the box. Typically when you buy a camera "body only" it comes with a battery, with an eye piece etc.... The import models do not, and they trick you into buying it with a mark down on the price. Also, inventory isn't reflected accurately on the website. So I bought an expensive camera that Im now going to have to wait 4 weeks to receive, at the exact same price I would have gotten from B$H - which would have been sent immediately.I also bought an expensive lens that is also going to be shipped in 4 weeks. B&H always has an accurate inventory so there are no surprises. I make a living out of photography so this is my work tool. I will have to wait 4 weeks to get it, postpone jobs, as I cannot cancel this order. Not worth the bs

Review.Titre: Great prices... if you like grey market.
Review.Contenu: They lure you with low prices on import (grey market) models which are not noted as such in the product descriptions. I only found this out when I called (at their request) to confirm my purchase, and their representative asked what battery I wanted to buy. When I asked if this was in addition to the included battery, he told me the camera didn't include a battery and was an import. He offered the US model for the same price as other retailers, but if I had known, I wouldn't have bought from them. I wish I had bought directly from Canon instead; for the same price I would have received the camera, a memory card (which Abes did include), and a lens adapter, which I had to buy separately from Abes. So it ended up costing $70 more all together, and the adapter is probably an import item as well. My complaint to customer service was ignored.

Review.Titre: Well they couldn't take my call our give me a final amount
Review.Contenu: So I had to place an order with free shipping except they say it may be charged an insurance amount.  SO....in this day and age of electronic commerce, they can't have that amount ahead of time, figured on my zip code???? I mean comon.  I called on the customer service and was sent to sales.. After 5 minutes, I hung up.  So if you read forums, they will try to upsell cables and white glove and this requred shipping insurance.  So it's just bad practice to as for a rating this soon.. Why are there so many people with 3 star ratings saying they haven't gotten far enough along in the process to rate them>>>>?So My rating is poor service at the start and we'll probably cancel the order rather than have an NON-authorized Dealer, selling non-returnable high dollar TVs and appliances this way.  If I get a great deal, then I'll mention the premature review request.

Review.Titre: how can I rate this when I haven't…
Review.Contenu: how can I rate this when I haven't gotten anything?? You shouldn't make consumers rate things at this stage.

I wish that I read the reviews about this company before making a purchase, because it's true: The company writes itself fake reviews. Within a minute of placing my order, I received four missed phone calls from these people, begging to confirm my order, and then they sent me an email. I called their phone number, because I understood that they wanted to confirm my order, it was a $900 purchase. However, they tack on more and more accessories in order to get you to spend more money. Instead of spending just under $940, I spent $1,099.99 because I decided to get the retail box that came with all the accessories.Instead of giving one star, I gave two because I still got a product that was a tad cheaper than what was being sold in retail. I haven't received the product yet, so I have no word on the quality of their products. But if it's still sealed, I am hoping that there is nothing to worry about. This is a grey market, so you're not buying from an authentic dealer. They do "bait and switch", so know what you are getting into, and do not accept their extra deals. This company is the equivalent to a used car salesman.

Review.Titre: The review survey is really annoying !
Review.Contenu: It is annoying that even before I finish checking out this review survey pops up and I cannot proceed further !

Review.Titre: This survey popped up before any…
Review.Contenu: This survey popped up before any confirmation of my order pooped up so I'm not super excited about that

Review.Titre: Why do you force a review when I can't…
Review.Contenu: Why do you force a review when I can't even see if my order processed?  That's annoying.

Review.Titre: I purchased a 65" LG OLED Flatscreen
Review.Contenu: I purchased a 65" LG OLED Flatscreen.  Read the fine print on TV's.  What you order and pay for on the screen is NOT what eventually gets billed.  Abes will email you and tell you that they require insured shipping on TV's.  They state this is obvious in the literature.  You can find it after they point it out but it's not obvious.  They do this with a message that says "Thanks again for your order! We very much appreciate your business with AbesofMaine.  Please call us at 800-992-2237 EXT 272. We need to confirm your purchase. That's win they give you the bad news about the uplift for insurance, but not how long the shipment will take.  I got an ear-full from a very poor CSR named Jeff Stevens for missing the fine print - obvious to him because he works this every day.  If not for another, nicer sales rep, I would have (and probably should have) just cancelled the order.  For my area, Abe's uses AM Home Delivery.  The TV was purchased on Sept 22nd.  AM Home Delivery needs to consolidate loads for shipments to Virginia (via Charlotte, NC - Note: the routing was New Jersey to Charlotte, NC, then to Richmond, VA).  It took 17 days for this purchase to make the 5 hour drive from New Jersey.  You know none of this when you purchase the TV.

I was told to call abesofmaine, and that's when I learned of why the prices are inexpensive. I didn't read the fine print that the camera was a gray market camera and the sales person was trying to sell me a retail model which I believe is also gray market, however the price for the retail model is the same as all the other online resellers (that are authorized resellers). I was told that I should get a third party warranty and I can't find any information on the third party warranty to find out if it's reputable or if there are reviews on it. I received no tracking number for my package and was told the lens is on backorder and should come in a couple weeks. So I'll have a camera body with no lens eventually and I don't know when it's shipping and I can't track it. I do know my credit card was charged, that part is certain. I believe the critical information should be more apparent. Let customers know if items are in stock before they place the online order, clearly mark items "International Model" and describe what exactly that means, last, explain how your third party warranty is reputable and will provide the customer more value than if they bought from an authorized reseller. I would also benefit from information that shows you respect the treatment and storage of products the same way an authorized reseller would.

Review.Titre: Very upset that they wouldn't Finance…
Review.Contenu: Very upset that they wouldn't Finance me. So I found my own financing
the customer service took too long. They kept transferring us and putting us on hold.
Good service, bad phone hours and not a consumer friendly return policy.

I started writing a whole story about my interaction, but then got bored with it. Long story short, after placing my order I received a call the next evening posing as a security check to make sure I actually ordered the camera. (After spending who knows how many thousands of dollars online over the years, no one does this.) The truth of the call was to get me to upgrade to the model I thought I was purchasing originally. (I was looking for the US model, they were selling the international model. Not labeled very well.) Also, they offered to "upgrade" my SD card to a faster model. The whole call just felt pushy and unnecessary.  After seeing my revised invoice, I see they've "upgraded" the SD card from my chosen Sandisk brand to a no-name brand; a clever way to boost their profits. I called back and expressed my frustration with that little bait-and-switch. On top of this, when I actually got the camera (a Canon 6D), the box labeled was one with the camera and 24-105mm lens kit. They didn't accidentally upgrade my order. They simply sent my camera in a different box. (I presume they sold off the original included lens and made a tidy profit at the expense of their customer's buying experience.) Certainly not the end of the world, but also not something I'd expect from a reputable seller.  Maybe if the original caller was more up front and had a modicum of phone skills, I wouldn't have felt burned. But given their practices and my experience, I'd rather pay a tiny bit more and actually enjoy the process.

Review.Titre: I JUST ORDERED I CANNOT REVIEW UNTIL I…
Review.Contenu: I JUST ORDERED I CANNOT REVIEW UNTIL I RECEIVE THE PRODUCT.

Review.Titre: My promo code as a new customer did not…
Review.Contenu: My promo code as a new customer did not work.

Review.Titre: i have had to order the samething twice…
Review.Contenu: i have had to order the samething twice now

Review.Titre: Please get my order shipped thanks
I don't want to do a survey
Review.Contenu: I did not have enough experience to rate this

Review.Titre: When I tried to record my shipping and…
Review.Contenu: When I tried to record my shipping and billing address into my new account, the web site would never allow me to populate the shipping fields by clicking to copy from billing entries. Use Abes only if you are a savvy buyer.  If you like the price and terms and you've read the fine print, then go for it.   But, be advised that they employ old school New York techniques that are questionable (IMO).     POSITIVES:1- I got what I paid for2- Paid the advertised price3- Shipping was free as advertised   NEGATIVES:1- They are not transparent about the meaning and implications of an "import model" camera. (ie. no USA warranty).2-  They require that you call them to ostensibly "confirm you order".  This leads to an up-sale session. Some people will find this objectionable, like having to worm you way out of a timeshare presentation before they let you check into your room.3-  I felt the sales was at best misinformed about certain technical issues when trying to sell me an aftermarket battery for me camera.    Abes does what they do to maximize profit, as any business should.  I would hope they change their ways about how they operate to a model more like a B&H,  thus building a truly good and lasting reputation.

Review.Titre: Started well but ended on a down note (and then recovered somewhat)
Review.Contenu: A decline from 5 to 1 stars. Placing the order online was smooth and easy. 5 Stars.  The call back from Abes to state the lens was back ordered down to 4 stars. Upsold to a 5 hr for the camera (allegedly the camera has a 1 hr battery) and an extra 5 hr battery. Three stars. Getting one Nikon 1230mAh (standard) and a generic 1800mAh battery 2 stars...explanation that these two batteries offer the same performance and are 5 hour battery. .1 star. They may have the same performance despite different ratings because one is Nikon and the other is poor quality generic but the Nikon is the standard battery not an upgrade and the generic can be had for much less elsewhere.  While the camera is good and at a good price. I would not buy here again. I cancelled the remaining order which I hope will go smoothly.  UPDATE - After the initial 1 star review, we received yet another call from Abes concerned about the low rating and the customer experience.  They offered a second 5hr 1800mAh battery free of charge to remedy the situation. Since they were willing to resolve the situation the overall experience has been upgraded to 3 stars.  Would have been five stars had they delivered what their website said was available when we ordered, and even with that four had we not have to deal with repeated phone calls to resolve the issue.

Review.Titre: Easy shopping & bad post order pressure
Review.Contenu: Easy shopping, good detailed information, exceptional pricing, free shipping, no sales tax outside of NJ. What's not to love about Abes of Maine?!They have a huge variety of TVs and electronics. From prior orders, never had a single issue with price, service, or product. Looking forward to my new TV.Edit:  After writing this review I got a call from Abe's as they wanted to verify my purchase. The agent was polite and friendly but there was an effort to up sale several items. I normally wouldn't take away a star, or in this case 2 stars for that, but when I passed on buying extra insurance, the agent told me I would fully responsible for the product, any damages that occurred, and it could not be returned. I told him that Abes provides a guarantee for all shipping per their website but he stated it didn't apply to TVs. I found this statement to be untrue. I deducted 1 star for this.I was then told they will ship the item when it arrives, having been told they had it in stock. I was quoted as delivery in 7 - 10 days but when the agent called he said 3 - 4 weeks. I felt (without evidence) that if I had purchased all the up sale items, I would have gotten my TV sooner. Left me with the impression that I was being penalized for not buying more. From that conversation I deducted another star. Below is their policy for the site and note there isn't an exception:Shop with confidence at Abe's of MaineServing our customers for over 30 Years!PRODUCTS ARE:Factory freshIn a secure cartIncludes all manufacturer supplied accessoriesMost orders are shipped within 24-48 hoursYou will not be responsible for boxes lost or damaged by the shipping carrier

I was looking to make a purchase for a videographer and producer and was given the name of the camera and gear needed. I googled the product and Abe's of Maine had the best price. After taking a look and deciding they were, in fact, a legitimate company, I made the purchase and went on with my day. I quickly received an email from them to call to verify the purchase. Since it was a large amount of money, I assumed that was the issue. I called and was immediately transferred to the person who emailed me. Ted was incredibly helpful. I had accidentally ordered a European version of the camera and lens. He not only helped me, but also honored the sale percentage on the original order. He then got it out rush shipping at around 6pm! They registered the warranties and everything. I couldn't be more pleased with the service we received from this small business. I highly recommend!
